title: "Saphyr (Variation V)" omer counter
marks:
Signature, Title, Date and Inscription

see Sign on bottom, in black: [\"SAPHYR\" / VARIATION V / Tob
text: Jewish tradition instructs the faithful to count the seven weeks between Passover and Shavuot - between the Exodus from Egypt and the giving of the Torah on Mount Sinai. The artist conceived each sculptural peg of this omer counter, one added each day, as a tiny abstract house. When all the pegs are in place on Shavuot, one envisions a united community.
description: rectangular base with 49 sculptural pegs; grey metallic patina; underside of pegs and peg holes are gold; pegs numbered on bottom; wood case  included
creditline: The Eloise and Elliot Kaplan Endowment for Judaica
